cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the intervention topic.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to aid in monitoring and data cleaning. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. This is a field that can be used on any Interventions CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record.
cdashModelFields.label: Any [Intervention]
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --YN
cdashModelFields.questionText: Has the subject had any [intervention topic(s)] (after/before) [study-specific time frame] (after/before [study-specific time frame] )?; [Was/Were] (there) any [intervention topic(s)] [taken/performed/used/collected] (after/before) [study-specific time frame]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the reported name of the treatment, drug, medicine, or therapy given during the dosing interval for the observation.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If --TRT is pre-printed/pre-specified, the value should also be mapped into the --TRT variable (e.g., if Oral Steroid is pre-printed on a CM CRF, "Oral Steroid" should be stored in CMTRT). The CDASH field --TRT can also be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor standardized value collected in the CDASH field --DECOD. For example, the CDASH field --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text intervention topic is collected in the CDASH field --TRT. In this scenario, the Item prompt "Specify Other" may be used.
cdashModelFields.label: Name of Treatment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TRT
cdashModelFields.prompt: [Treatment/Investigational Product/Intervention Name]; [Specify Other/Explain/Specify Details] [Treatment/Investigational Product/Intervention Name]
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (type of) [treatment/investigational product/intervention topic]?; [If Other is selected], [explain/specify/provide more details].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable, --TRT, or the modified topic variable (-- MODIFY), if applicable.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When populated by a coding dictionary (e.g., WHO Drug or MedDRA), Question Text and Prompt are not applicable. WHO Drug may be used for coding treatment names and MedDRA may be used for coding procedures. When these dictionaries are used, --DECOD is equivalent to those dictionaries' Preferred Term. The CDASH field --DECOD may be used to collect standardized pre-specified values (CDISC Controlled Terminology or sponsor-defined) on a CRF. The CDASH field --TRT can be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor standardized value. For example, the CDASH field --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text intervention topic is collected in CDASH field --TRT.
cdashModelFields.label: Standardized Treatment Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DECOD
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/ was] the [treatment/intervention topic]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C125923

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The mode or condition of the record that specifies whether the intervention (activity) is intended to happen or has happened.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: "SCHEDULED" is used when collecting subject-level intended dose records. "PERFORMED" is used when collecting subject-level actual dose records. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If collecting both scheduled and performed dosing in the same horizontal record, the sponsor may append "_SCHEDULED" to the variable name to capture the scheduled dose.
cdashModelFields.label: Mood
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --MOOD
cdashModelFields.questionText: Does this record describe scheduled treatment or performed treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically come from a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG.
cdashModelFields.label: Category
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --CAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the category (of the [intervention])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A sub-division of the --CAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. --SCAT can only be used if there is a --CAT. If a question is asked, the response would typically come from a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG.
cdashModelFields.label: Subcategory
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SCAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the subcategory (of the [intervention])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is pre-specified on a CRF.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: For pre-specified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF may be defaulted to Y, or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified interventions and free-text interventions, the value of --PRESP should be Y for all pre-specified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.
cdashModelFields.label: Pre-Specified Intervention
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that the pre-specified intervention happened or was administered when information about the occurrence of the specific intervention is solicited.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used for specific interventions that are collected as defined by the protocol. If the term is pre-printed/pre-specified, the value should also be mapped into the --TRT variable (e.g., if Oral Steroid is pre-printed on a CM CRF, "Oral Steroid" should be stored in CMTRT). The CDASH field --OCCUR is not used for spontaneously free-text reported --TRT. Should not be used to indicate data was not collected. Used only when the value can be collected using values from the CDISC CT (NY) codelist. --OCCUR is a Yes/No variable and in the SDTM submission datasets, --OCCUR is populated only for the records where --PRESP is "Y" and is null when --PRESP is null.
cdashModelFields.label: Occurrence
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --OCCUR
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was [--TRT/ intervention] [taken/performed/administered/consumed] (after/before [study-specific time frame])?;Has the subject [had/taken/performed/administered/consumed] the [--TRT/ intervention]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The variable used to indicate whether data are available, by having the site recording the value as "Yes" or "No".
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Using --PERF, a negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE". --PERF can be used instead of --STAT when a Y/N response list is needed for implementation. Examples: Were prior medications assessed? Were medications of interest assessed? \n
cdashModelFields.label: [Observation] Performed
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable --STAT to indicate when a pre-specified Intervention was not assessed. If the CDASH variable --PERF="N", the value of the STDM variable --STAT is "NOT DONE". If --PERF= "Y", --STAT is null.
cdashModelFields.name: --PERF
cdashModelFields.questionText: (Were/Was) (the) [intervention topic] [answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The value of "Not Done" indicates either that data are not available or the question was not asked. Do not use this CDASH field when collecting information on whether or not a pre-specified intervention was performed; this should be recorded using the CDASH field --OCCUR.
cdashModelFields.label: Completion Status
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (column in the Define-XML) = "CRF"; if populated from other sources such as a free text or sponsor-defined listing for --REASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
cdashModelFields.name: --STAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was the [intervention topic] not [answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available]?; Indicate if ([intervention topic] was) not [answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An explanation of why data are not available.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason Not Done
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --REASND
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the reason that the [Interventions topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The condition, disease, symptom, or disorder that the intervention was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered, why the procedure was performed).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture the indication(s)/medical problem(s) why a subject took/had an intervention. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis, or for reconciling the interventions as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process.
cdashModelFields.label: Indication
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --INDC
cdashModelFields.questionText: For what indication was the [--TRT] [taken/performed/administered/consumed]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The amount of substance (e.g., --TRT) given at one time, represented as a numeric value.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used when the dose/amount taken/administered/consumed has only numeric entries. If non-numeric entries are possible, use the CDASH field --DSTXT.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSE
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/ was] the (individual) (intended) [dose/amount] (of [--TRT] [taken/performed/administered/consumed/per administration])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The amount of substance (e.g., --TRT) given at one time, represented in text format.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text, or ranges.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose Description
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not directly map to SDTM. Maps to either --DOSE or DOSTXT.
cdashModelFields.name: --DSTXT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (individual) (intended) [dose/amount] (of [--TRT] [taken/performed/administered/consumed/per administration])?

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When possible, this is pre-printed on the CRF with the associated treatment. Dose unit may be derived via other methods (e.g., from protocol, from data). When collected, the unit is pre-printed on the CRF or a field is provided on the CRF to capture it.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit (for the dose/amount of [--TRT])?

cdashModelFields.name: --DOSFRM

cdashModelFields.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., --DOSE ,--DOSEU,--DOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.

cdashModelFields.definition: The total amount of --TRT taken over a day, using the units in --DOSU.

cdashModelFields.name: --DOSTOT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the total [dose/amount] (of the [--TRT/Intervention] [taken/performed/administered/consumed])?

cdashModelFields.definition: The text description of the intended dosing schedule for the administration of the intervention.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When possible, the options for intended dose regimen are pre-printed on the CRF. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently. Example: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.

cdashModelFields.name: --ROUTE
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the route of administration (of the [--TRT])?

cdashModelFields.definition: Lot number of the intervention product.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The lot number identifies the manufacturing batch of the intervention product. In open-label studies, the reference number on the product container may represent an actual lot number and should be submitted using --LOT. This variable may be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets. Do not collect other identification variables in this field.

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the associated field on the CRF was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the intervention was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose Adjusted
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. If the Reason for Dose Adjustment is not collected, the sponsor might chose to submit this as a supplemental qualifier.

cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/was] the (study treatment/procedure) [dose/amount] adjusted?

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether of not the intervention was interrupted.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the actual duration of the interruption is collected using the CDASH field --CINTD. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPP--.QVAL dataset where SUPP--.QNAM = "--ITRPYN" and SUPP--.QLABEL = "Intervention Interrupted".
cdashModelFields.label: Intervention Interrupted
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/was] the [--TRT/Intervention] interrupted?

cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The reason the intervention did not occur may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., SUBJECT MISTAKE, SUBJECT REFUSED) or entered as free text. When --REASOC is used, --OCCUR must also be populated in the SDTM dataset with a value of "N".
cdashModelFields.label: Reason for Occur Value
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--REASOC" and SUPP--.QLABEL ="Reason for Occur Value". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --REASOC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the reason that the [intervention topic] was (not) [performed/taken/done/administered]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication why the intervention was interrupted.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This CDASH field is use to collected the reason an intervention was interrupted. Sponsors may define their own controlled terminology.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason Intervention Interrupted
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--ITRPRS" and SUPP--.QLABEL ="Reason Intervention Interrupted". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --ITRPRS
cdashModelFields.questionText: Why was the [--TRT/Intervention] interrupted?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The collected duration of the intervention interruption.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This CDASH field is use to collected the duration of an intervention interruption. In some situations, the duration of the interruption may not be collected but calculated from the intervention start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Interruption Duration
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--ITRPD" and SUPP--.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected intervention interruption duration and the duration unit components and create --ITRPD using ISO 8601 period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --CINTD
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the duration of the [--TRT/Intervention] interruption?; How long was the [--TRT/Intervention] interruption?

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
End Relative to Reference Time Point

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication of whether the substance was used and when it was used.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The preferred SDTM mapping is provided. This information is usually not submitted in a SUPP--.QVAL dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Never Current Former Usage
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable --OCCUR. If --NCF = "Never", the value of --OCCUR will be "N". If --NCF = "Current" or "Former", the value of --OCCUR will be "Y". May also be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --STRTPT or --STRF. If the value of --NCF is "Former", the value of ""BEFORE" may be used. If the value of --NCF is "current", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When populating --STRTPT, if the value of --NCF is "Former", the value of "BEFORE" may be used. Note: --STRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in --STTPT. This variable may also be used to populate the SDTM ending relative timing variables.
cdashModelFields.name: --NCF
cdashModelFields.questionText: Has the subject ever [used/consumed] [--TRT/Intervention]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the intervention is ongoing as of a given timepoint when no end date is provided.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --ONGO allows specific question text/prompt about interventions ending after the study or after a given timepoint. Select the appropriate text when designing the CRF. This may also be included in the CRF title or instructions. Used in conjunction with either a reference timepoint (--ENTPT, --ENRTPT) or in conjunction with the Study Reference Period (described as RFSTDTC to RFENDTC). May also be used as a tick/checkbox. See CDASHIG Section 3.7 for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Ongoing Intervention
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --ENRF or --ENRTPT. When populating --ENRF, or --ENRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field --ONGO is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When --ONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTM variable --ENRF should be populated. When --ONGO is compared to another timepoint, the SDTM variables --ENRTPT and --ENTPT should be used. Note: --ENRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in --ENTPT.
cdashModelFields.name: --ONGO
cdashModelFields.prompt: Ongoing (as of the [Study-Specific Timepoint or Period])
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] the [--TRT/Intervention] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A free-text comment.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If an additional free-text field is needed to provide a comment about a particular record, use the COVAL(n) field to collect the free text, and associate the free-text comment with the original record using SDTM variables RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF. See the SDTMIG for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Comment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the CDASH variable --COVAL maps to the SDTM variable COVAL (COVAL2, COVAL3) in the CO domain. Associate the free-text comment in the CO domain with the original record using RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF.
cdashModelFields.name: COVAL
cdashModelFields.prompt: [Abbreviated version of the protocol-specified targeted question]
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Protocol-specified Targeted Question]?

This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPP--.QVAL dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP--dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--SOCCD" and SUPP--.QLABEL = "Primary System Organ Class Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --SOCCD

classes.description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2021-06-25)
classes.label: Interventions

Used primarily as a data cleaning field, this provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. If the response to YES/NO is planned to be submitted in the SDTM submission datasets, this CDASH variable should not be used and the appropriate CDASH variable should be used instead (e.g., --OCCUR).

cdashModelFields.definition: The topic variable for an event observation, which is the reported or pre-specified name of the event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Typically, --TERM collects the verbatim text for an event. If the term is preprinted/pre-specified, the value can be populated into the --TERM variable as a hidden field (e.g., if Headache is printed on an AE CRF, "Headache" should be stored in AETERM). The CDASH field --TERM can also be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor-standardized value collected in the CDASH field --DECOD. For example, --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text event topic is collected in --TERM. In this scenario, the Item prompt "Specify Other" may be used.

cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TERM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [event topic/term/name]?; If --DECOD (is selected), [explain/specify/provide (more) detail(s)]?

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable; --TERM; or the modified topic variable (-- MODIFY), if applicable.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When populated by a coding dictionary (e.g., MedDRA), Question Text and Prompt may not be applicable. This is equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT) in MedDRA. CDISC Controlled terminology (NCOMPLT) is used for the DS domain only. The CDASH field --DECOD may be used to collect standardized pre-specified values (CDISC Controlled Terminology or sponsor-defined terminology) on a CRF. The CDASH field --TERM can be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor-standardized value. For example, the CDASH field --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text event topic is collected in the CDASH field --TERM.

cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the event is ongoing as of a given timepoint when no end date is provided.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --ONGO allows specific question text/prompt about events ending prior to the given timepoint. Select the appropriate text when designing the CRF. This may also included in the CRF title or instructions. Used in conjunction with either a reference timepoint (--ENTPT, --ENRTPT) or in conjunction with the study reference period (described as RFSTDTC to RFENDTC). May also be used as a tick/checkbox. See CDASHIG Section 3.7 for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Ongoing Event
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --ENRF or --ENRTPT. When populating --ENRF, or --ENRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field --ONGO is "Y", a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When --ONGO refers to the study reference period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTM variable --ENRF should be populated. When --ONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTM variables --ENRTPT and --ENTPT should be used. Note: --ENRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in --ENTPT.
cdashModelFields.name: --ONGO
cdashModelFields.prompt: Ongoing (as of the [Study-Specific Timepoint or Period])
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] the [--TERM/event topic] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period])?

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the finding topic.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record. Used primarily as a data-cleaning field or to dynamically drive EDC form functionality, this provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. For example, used in the DD domain to indicate no information on any death details are being provided, or used in the IE domain to indicate whether the subject met all the eligibility requirements for this study at the time the subject was enrolled. \n --PERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, observations were done.
cdashModelFields.label: Any [Finding]
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --YN
cdashModelFields.questionText: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] ([study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were/Is] (there) [a/any] [Findings topic(s)] (reported/available) ([study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test, or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".
cdashModelFields.label: [Observation] Performed
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable --STAT. If the CDASH variable --PERF="N", the value of the STDM variable --STAT is "NOT DONE". If --PERF= "Y", --STAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., --CAT and --SCAT, --TPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable --TESTCD would be populated with --ALL and an appropriate test name (--TEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.name: --PERF
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Were (any)/Was (the)] [--TEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/question(s)/assessment(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s)]) [performed/collected]?

cdashModelFields.definition: Text description of any findings.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: --RES and --DESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See CDASHIG Section 8.3.1, General Finding Assumptions.
cdashModelFields.label: Description of Finding
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, if the CDASH field -- RES = "NORMAL/ABSENT", populate the SDTM variables --ORRES and --STRESC with the value of the CDASH field --RES. If the value of the CDASH field --RES is "ABNORMAL/PRESENT", populate the SDTM variable --ORRES with the CDASH field --DESC. If the reported findings in --DESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable --STRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and --MODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in --DESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable --STRESC is populated with the CDASH --DESC field. The SDTM variable --NRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate.
cdashModelFields.name: --DESC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (description) of the [(abnormality/observed finding/Sponsor-defined)]?

This field may be populated by the sponsor's data management system.

cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --GRPID
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?

cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LNKID
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] identifier?

Other device identifiers, such as serial number, may instead be used on the CRF. If this is the case, sponsors should use controlled terminology for the SPDEVID elements as variable names where possible. Sponsors should also ensure that, when necessary, those elements required for deriving SPDEVID are captured.

cdashModelFields.definition: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT can be used for sorting.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system or derived from the variable VISIT. Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit numbering or visit naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In these cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names may need to be populated when the SDTM submission datasets are created.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Number
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: VISITNUM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What is the visit number?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Protocol-defined description of the clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY as a text description of the clinical encounter.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The name of the visit is typically pre-printed on the CRF, and should match the name of the visit in the protocol. May be used to derive the SDTM variable VISITNUM. Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit numbering or visit naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In these cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names may need to be populated when the SDTM submission datasets are created.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: VISIT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. A date/time can be collected once for the whole visit using the Visit Date/Time field and applying that date/time to all of the observations at that visit. The date (--DTC) of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components, and populating the STDMIG variable --DTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTMIG SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVSTDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISDAT and VISTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Time the clinical encounter took place (or started).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. A date/time can be collected once for the whole visit using the Visit Date/Time field and applying that date/time to all of the observations at that visit. The date (--DTC) of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM). For SDTM submission datasets, concatenate CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components, and populate the STDMIG variable --DTC in ISO 8601 format. May be used to populate SVSTDTC, and SVENDTC in the SDTMIG SV domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Time
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTMIG SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVSTDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISDAT and VISTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISTIM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (start) time of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Date the clinical encounter ended.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. This is the end date of the visit. This may be useful when a study extends over 2 or more days.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit End Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVENDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISENDAT and VISENTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISENDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the end date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Time the clinical encounter ended.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. This is the end time of the visit, and may be useful when a study extends over 2 or more days.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit End Time
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVENDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISENDAT and VISENTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISENTIM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the end time of the visit?

cdashModelFields.definition: Collection date of an observation.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is a generic DATE field that can be implemented in a system that will store partial dates. Use this for date of data collection, visit date, visit start date, point-in-time collection (e.g., vital signs measurements, lab sample collection date), or start date for interval collection of measurements or tests (e.g., start date of a 24-hour urine collection). Section 4.1.4.1 of the FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guide v2.2a indicates that when dates have the role of a timing variable, the matching Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, or --ENDY, respectively) are included in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Collection Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable --DTC in ISO 8601 format. Section 4.1.4.1 of the FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guidea indicates that when dates have the role of a timing variable, the matching Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, or --ENDY, respectively) should be included in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.name: --DAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the date the [event or intervention] [is/was] collected?; What [is/was] the (start) date (of the [Finding])?

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the event/intervention/finding started or occurred prior to a specified time point.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --PRIOR allows specific question text and prompt about interventions, events or findings that were prior to a specified timepoint. --PRIOR is used in conjunction with either a reference timepoint (--STTPT, --ENTPT) or the Study Reference Period (described as RFSTDTC to RFENDTC). See CDASHIG Section 3.7 for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Prior
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --STRF or --STRTPT. When populating --STRF, or --STRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field --PRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When --PRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable --STRF should be populated. When --PRIOR is compared to another timepoint, the SDTM variables --STRTPT and --STTPT should be used. Note: --STRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in --STTPT.
cdashModelFields.name: --PRIOR
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was the [--TRT/Intervention] [taken/performed/used/administered/consumed/started/occurred] prior to a [specified timepoint]?; Did the [--TERM/event topic/--TRT/Intervention/Finding] [start/occur] prior to [specified timepoint]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Planned time point names are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time point names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header. In the SDTM submission dataset, time points can be represented using the time point variables --TPT, --TPTNUM,-- ELTM. See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Planned Time Point Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTM time point anchors --TPTREF (text description) and --RFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTM variables --TPTNUM, --ELTM.
cdashModelFields.name: --TPT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the planned time point [of the/for the] [measurement/observation/collection]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.name: --TPTNUM

cdashModelFields.definition: The collected or pre-populated text description of an interval associated with an observation such as a finding --TESTCD.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --CEVINT (which is stored as free text) indicates a period of time during which an observation is being made or about which a question is being asked (e.g., "During the past 6 months what was the subject's average sleep time?" or "Record any significant cardiovascular medical history over the subject's lifetime."). The evaluation interval free text is defaulted in the hidden CDASH field --CEVINT (e.g., PAST 6 MONTHS, LIFETIME). Intervals that can be converted to ISO format (e.g., PAST 6 WEEKS), are mapped to the SDTM variable --EVLINT (-P6W), and free-text interval are mapped to --EVINTX (LIFETIME). See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Evaluation Interval
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, convert the collect evaluation interval into an ISO 8601 period format and populate the SDTM variable --EVLINT or if the interval can not be converted to an ISO format, populate the SDTM variable --EVINTX.
cdashModelFields.name: --CEVINT
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Included as part of a protocol-specified question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Duration of interval associated with an observation, such as a finding --TESTCD.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --EVLINT indicates a period of time during which an observation is being made or about which a question is being asked which is represented in an ISO format. This would be a hidden field on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. The evaluation interval is included in the question text and the hidden CDASH field --EVLINT is defaulted using the appropriate ISO format for the interval. Example: "During the past 6 months, what was the subject's average sleep time?" is the question text; the hidden CDASH field --EVLINT would be "-P6M". See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Evaluation Interval
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --EVLINT

cdashModelFields.definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable. It is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTM variables DTHDTC and DTHFL are mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS), as deemed appropriate by the sponsor. Death Date can be collected as a single field, or as three fields (DTHMO, DTHDD and DTHYY).
cdashModelFields.label: Death Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DM.DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: DTHDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?

description: The Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Model describes the foundational structure for the organization, naming, and description of variables and associated attributes to support data collection in clinical trials. The CDASH Model provides naming conventions for the CDASH Implementation Guide (CDASHIG) variables along with additional metadata to help facilitate mapping collected data to their respective SDTM Implementation Guide (SDTMIG) variables.

fields.definition: An adverse event of special interest (serious or non-serious) is one of scientific and medical concern specific to the sponsor's product or program, for which ongoing monitoring and rapid communication by the investigator to the sponsor can be appropriate. Such an event might warrant further investigation in order to characterize and understand it. Depending on the nature of the event, rapid communication by the trial sponsor to other parties (e.g., regulators) might also be warranted.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH field may be used just to trigger other CRF pages, or to populate a value in AECAT or AESCAT. If submitted, this information could be submitted in a SUPP--.QVAL dataset where SUPP--.QNAM= "AESI" and SUPP--.QLABEL = "Adverse Event of Special Interest". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.

fields.definition: The age of the subject, expressed in AGEU.
fields.implementationNotes: If Age is collected, it should be collected as a number and, to be correctly interpreted, the age value should be associated to a variable for the Age Unit. It may be necessary to know when the age was collected, as an age may need to be recalculated for analysis, such as deriving age at a reference start time (RFSTDTC for SDTM). BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns). If Age is collected, it is recommended that the date of collection also be recorded, either separately or by association to the date of the visit.

fields.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (US Centers for Disease Control).
fields.implementationNotes: When collecting data on race of subjects, use the US FDA's 5 designations for race (American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, White).a If collecting data outside the US, the recommendation is to use the same categories, except for Black instead of Black or African American. If multiple races are collected, an alternate sponsor-defined variable structure is required. Sponsors may record multiple self-reported races for a subject by appending a suffix to denote multiple collected races (e.g., RACE1, RACE2) and populate RACE with the value MULTIPLE. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidancea; see also SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.label: Race
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: RACE
fields.questionText: Which of the following 5 racial designations best describes you? (More than one choice is acceptable.)

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C128689

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

fields.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (U.S. Center for Disease Control).
fields.implementationNotes: Use CRACE when more detailed race categorizations are desired (e.g., more than the 5 designations for race used by the FDA). The HL7's race and vocabulary tables are recommended, as these are designed to collapse up to the SDTM variable RACE with CT (e.g., American Indian or Alaska Native Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, White). When collecting data outside the US, the recommended categories are the same except for Black instead of Black or African American. If multiple races are collected, an alternate sponsor-defined variable structure is required. Sponsors may record multiple self-reported races for a subject by appending a suffix to denote multiple collected races (e.g., CRACE1, CRACE2) and populate CRACE with the value MULTIPLE. If sponsors choose to map the extended Race codelist values to the RACE CT (e.g., Japanese to Asian ), then this mapped variable would be reported using the SDTMIG variable RACE. Sponsors should refer to FDA guidance.a
fields.label: Collected Race
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL when SUPPDM.QNAM = "CRACE" and SUPPDM.QLABEL="Collected Race". See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: CRACE
fields.questionText: Which of the following racial designations best describes you? (More than one choice is acceptable.)

fields.definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history, origin, and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage, which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease. When submitting to the FDA, the collected values must be rolled up to the permissible values in ETHNIC.
fields.implementationNotes: Use when values are collected using the NCI Thesaurus codelist for Ethnicity As Collected (C128690), the extended HL7 hierarchy of codelist values, or other regulatory agency-specific controlled terminology for ethnic group. Sponsors may append a suffix to denote multiple collected ethnicities (e.g., CETHNIC1, CETHNIC2).
fields.label: Collected Ethnicity
fields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL when SUPPDM.QNAM = "CETHNIC" and SUPPDM.QLABEL = "Collected Ethnicity". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.

fields.implementationNotes: If only collected age ranges (e.g., 0-3, 18-25, >65) are expected, those should be collected using AGETXT. If collecting age descriptions (e.g., neonate, adolescent, adult), those must be collected using CAGETXT.
fields.label: Collected Age Text
fields.mappingInstructions: If the collected value is a range, then the result maps directly to AGETXT. If the collected value is a description, the result maps to SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "CAGETXT" and SUPPDM.QLABEL = "Collected Age Text".
fields.name: CAGETXT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the subject's age (description)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

fields.definition: A free-text field to be used when none of the pre-printed values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection should be added to those pre-printed values.
fields.implementationNotes: When creating the Demographics form, it is suggested that the 5 standard race categories be included. Sponsors may include another value of Specify, Other with a free-text field for extending the list of values. The RACEOTH variable contains the free-text added by the site. The value(s) added in the optional variable might or might not collapse up into one of the 5 categories specified by the FDA Guidance.b See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.label: Race Other
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "RACEOTH" and SUPP.QLABEL="RACE OTHER". See SDTMIG for additional information, Demographics. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
fields.name: RACEOTH
fields.questionText: What was the other race?

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

fields.definition: An indication the subject's treatment information was revealed to any unauthorized site personnel during the trial.
fields.implementationNotes: There may be multiple rows in the SDTM DS dataset to represent this information, each with the appropriate DSCAT values. One row could indicate the treatment was unblinded (using DSCAT= "OTHER EVENT") and another row could indicate the status of the subject at the end of their participation in the trial (using DSCAT = "DISPOSTION"). If DSUNBLND is "Yes" and information was collected about the reason for the unblinding, populate DSCAT with "OTHER EVENT" and the SDTMIG variables DSTERM with the free text and DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text (e.g., TREATMENT UNBLINDED). If DSUNBLND is "Yes", and the unblinding also resulted in the subject discontinuing the trial prematurely, populate DSCAT with "DISPOSTION" and use the SDTMIG variables DSTERM and DSDECOD to capture the applicable discontinuation details. If the unblinding occurred due to an adverse event, DSTERM contains the text of the adverse event. In the AE domain, the SDTMIG variable AEACNOTH ("Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?" ) may include text of "Treatment Unblinded". DSUNBLND may also be used to document intentional unblinding at a protocol-defined point in the trial.
fields.label: Unblinded
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. If the CDASH field DSUNBLIND = "Y", then the SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM = "TREATMENT UNBLINDED" and DSCAT = "OTHER EVENT". If DSUNBLIND = "N", then the CRF should be annotated to indicate that this value is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: DSUNBLND
fields.questionText: [Is/Was] treatment (unblinded/unmasked) by the site?
